intro: Batrachium paucistamineum var. drouetii, commonly known as the Drouet's batrachium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
